intro: Diostea chamaedryfolia, commonly known as the rock rose, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky or gravelly soils. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Diostea chamaedryfolia is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
